page.title: 01General Landscape
page.content: FARMING IS MAINLY IN THE AREA ASSIGNED TO THIS SCHOOL. WE HAVE IVESTIGATED MOORHOUSE FARM . IT IS COUNCIL OWNED AND IS FARMED BY A FAMILY CALLED JOLL. THEY HAVED FARMED IN THIS AREA FOR TWO GENERATIONS. IT IS A MIXED FARM GROWING POTATOES, SWEDES, TURNIPS, AND GRASS FOR THEIR DAIRY HERD. THEY OWN 46 cows AND THE MILK IS COLLECTED DAILY FROM THEIR GATE.THEY FARM ABOUT 86 ACRES. THERE ARE THREE SONS WITH AN AGE RANGE FROM ELEVEN YEARS TO TWENTY. THEY ARE NOT SURE IF THEY INTEND TO FARM WHEN THEIR FATHER RETIRES AS FARMING IS AN UNECONOMIC ENTERPRISE IN VIEW OF THE MANY RESTRICTIONS PLACED UPON BRTISH FARMERS THROUGH THE COMMON MARKET. THEY RECEIVE A SUBSIDY FROM THE EEC AS MOORHOUSE FARM COMES UNDER THE SPECIAL TERMS OF HILL FARMING.
